sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Suppose set A = {1, 2, 3} and set B = {2, 3, 4}. Let C = {4, 5, 6}. Compute (A x B) ∩ C and A x (B ∩ C), and illustrate that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
